thread.title: Twitter’s Blackbirds launch bot for Black History Month
thread.title_full: Twitter’s Blackbirds launch bot for Black History Month

author: Megan Rose Dickey
title: Twitter’s Blackbirds launch bot for Black History Month
text:
Twitter’s Blackbirds launch bot for Black History Month Posted Reserve raises another $10M and plans new software for restaurants 
Twitter’s employee resource group for African-Americans, Blackbirds, is launching a Twitter bot for Black History Month. The group is the first ERG at Twitter to use the tool, which Twitter launched in November. 
To chat with the bot, all you have to do is direct message @Blackbirds. From there, the bot will tell you one of four things: a today in #BlackHistory fact, a community event in cities like New York, San Francisco or Atlanta (#ForTheCause), tips on #SelfCare or notable moments and content from prominent black people on Twitter (#ForTheCulture). 
But based on the way Blackbirds designed the bot, people will only be able to interact via quick replies, as all of the answers have been pre-loaded. If people respond with something racist, the bot won’t recognize it as a valid response. welcome
